    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Matrix​(double[][] data)
      Class constructor that accepts a 2d array of doubles and creates a Matrix object from the accepted 2d array.
      Matrix​(java.lang.String filename)
      Class constructor that accepts a file path as a String and creates a Matrix object from the accepted file path.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Public method that takes no arguments. Overrides Java's built-in toString() method to return a String consisting of the current Matrix's data.

        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • equals

        public boolean equals​(Matrix other)
        Public method that accepts a Matrix object as an argument, iterates over the current matrix and the accepted matrix, and checks if each of their cells are equal. Overrides Java's built-in equals() method.
        Parameters:
        other -
        Returns:

      • transpose

        public Matrix transpose()
        Public method take takes no parameters. Returns a new Matrix object which is the transposed current Matrix object.
        Returns:

      • add

        public Matrix add​(Matrix other)
        Public method that accepts a Matrix object as a parameter. Adds the value of each cell from the accepted Matrix object and the current Matrix object if the two matrices are the same dimensions. Returns a new Matrix object consisting of the sums.
        Parameters:
        other -
        Returns:

      • mult

        public Matrix mult​(double scalar)
        Public method that accepts a double as a parameter. Iterates over the current Matrix object and multiplies each cell with the accepted double. Returns a new Matrix object from the scalar multiplication.
        Parameters:
        scalar -
        Returns:

      • mult

        public Matrix mult​(Matrix other)
        Public method that accepts a Matrix object as a parameter and multiples it with the current Matrix object. Returns the resulting Matrix object.
